clue.text: Come by five, do you mean?

steps.hint: Roman numeral V = 5

steps.note: The question 'do you mean?' reads as its spoken equivalent 'IS IT' - the phrase you'd say when asking for confirmation

definition.hint: 'Come by' suggests dropping in on someone - find a common 5-letter word for this

wordplay.hint: A Roman numeral followed by a conversational phrase that reads as spoken

clue.text: See boss bungle work

steps.hint: To 'bish' something is British slang for bungling it
OP = opus, a musical work or composition

definition.hint: A 'see' is a diocese - who runs one?

wordplay.hint: A slang word for making a mistake plus an abbreviation for a musical composition

steps.hint: A rave is an all-night dance party
N represents any number in mathematics

clue.text: A lot of sharp turns, I'm afraid

steps.hint: Keen means sharp, as in a keen edge or keen intellect

steps.note: 'A lot of' means take most of the word - remove final letter

wordplay.hint: Take most of a word meaning sharp/eager, then reverse it

definition.hint: Related to vision or the eye

wordplay.hint: First letter of a word plus an anagram of some letters

steps.hint: 'Out to lunch' is slang for crazy or mad
An aga is a Turkish military commander or chief
A coach is a type of vehicle/car, especially a horse-drawn one

steps.note: Reads as 'mad Aga's car' - a crazy Turkish leader's vehicle

definition.hint: An island nation off the coast of Africa

wordplay.hint: The whole phrase sounds like a description of a crazy vehicle belonging to a Turkish commander

clue.text: Moderate movement also opposed to one referendum option

steps.hint: 'Also' links things together, like the word 'and'
Anti- means opposed to or against
In a referendum, one option is to vote 'No'

definition.hint: A musical tempo marking - slower than allegro but not as slow as adagio

expected.text: which strongly suggests criminal is mom

clue.text: Cover up in shower not after nurses turn around

steps.hint: If you're BY something (beside it), you're not AFTER it - cryptic wordplay
To roll is to turn around (like rolling over)
'nurses' = contains; BY wraps around ROLL: B + ROLL + Y = BROLLY

definition.hint: Something you use to stay dry when it rains

wordplay.hint: A container operation with a reversal inside

clue.text: Flatter track takes very little time

steps.hint: To stalk is to track or follow prey
Wee means very little or tiny (Scottish/informal)
T is standard abbreviation for time
STALK takes WEE+T = S(WEET)ALK = SWEET TALK

definition.hint: To cajole or flatter someone with charming words

clue.text: But you must wear socks steamy in here

steps.hint: Thou is archaic/biblical form of 'you'
Hose is another word for stockings/socks (hosiery)
HOSE containing THOU = HO(THOU)SE = HOTHOUSE

definition.hint: A warm glass building for growing plants

wordplay.hint: A container with an archaic pronoun inside footwear

times-29453-8d.reported_issue:
Meta data issue. EVery synonym must have a verifiable hint
SYNONYM: socks → HOSE
'socks' = HOSE **Remember:** Synonyms are the bread and butter of cryptic wordplay.

A bass is a type of singer (low male voice)
A dress is a costume or outfit

steps.hint: A duo is a couple or pair
A mo (moment) is a brief second of time

US is abbreviation for United States (American)
APICES welcoming US = A(US)PICES = AUSPICES

definition.text: One missing initially admitted to Electra with some upheaval?

expected.text: One missing initially admitted to Electra with some upheaval?
